data.protoText:
1. Culture conditions
 One day before a transfection experiment,HEK293 cell Plating 2-5 x 106 cells in a 60-mm culture dish,5 mL of medium;18 h overnight

2. Transfection of cells    
HEK293(Plate cells as above to give 60-80%)4mL culture medium  with up to 1 mL of transfection complex medium.
0.6 mL of serum-free high-glucose DMEM and add 2 µg of each plasmid.Add 8 μL of the Targeting Systems Targefect F-2 transfection reagent.complex for 25 min at 37oC.
Add 0.6 mL of the transfection complex to the medium and gently swirl the culture dish to ensure transfection complexes are spread evenly over the entire field of cells. Incubate for 36-48 h at 37oC
After 36 h,measure Luc activities in supernatant media after centrifugation.
Protocol using cell culture medium to measure secreted Luc activity
Pipette 5-10 μL of cell culture medium, after centrifugation, into tubes or wells of a microtiter plate
Add 50 μL of the working CLAR reagent from the UltraBriteTM Cypridina-Gaussia Dual Luciferase Assay Reagent and measure CLuc activity in a microplate luminometer
CLAR reagent: diluting the 100x Cyripdina luciferin (50 μL) to 5 mL using the CLAR Substrate Dilution Buffer
Wait 1-2 min and then add 50 μL of the working GAR Quench and GloTM Reagent. Mix the plate samples gently and then measure GLuc photon release by luminometry
Working reagent:diluting 50 μL of the 100x GAR Substrate Solution to 5 mL using the GAR Quench and GloTM Dilution Buffer
Protocol using cell culture lysates to measure intracellular Luc activity
Dilute 5x CLR-01 buffer to 1x using water.
Add enough lysis buffer (50 μL/96-well, 300 μL/ 12-well, 800 μL/6- well plate and 3 mL /10 cm dish).
Shake for 20 min at 400 rpm on an orbital shaker at room temperature
Aspirate the cell culture medium and wash cells twice with serum-free DMEM.
5-10 µL of Luc-containing cell lysate and CLAR reagent from the UltraBriteTM Cypridina-Gaussia Dual Luciferase Assay Reagent and to measure CLuc activity and then GLuc activity in the cell lystates.
